results.title: The Nights Belong to the Novelist: the Imaginitive World of Elizabeth Jolley, Australian Writer
results.brief_description: This program is a warm, humorous and thoroughly engaging look at one of Australia’s prominent contemporary writers. Elizabeth Jolley discusses her writing, and talks about how she develops her characters and stories. The film utilises selected dramatised sequences throughout, to highlight the nuances and creativity of Jolley’s works.

results.title: The Nightmare before Christmas
results.creator_credit: Henry Selick, Tim Burton, Denise Di Novi and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: This delightfully different animated fantasy opens the door to an intriguing new world - where extraordinary surprises and captivating music await. Journey on an incredible adventure of fantastic sights and sounds with the whimsical characters, Pumpkin Jack, Jack Skellington, and the rag doll, Sally. One day Jack discovers Christmastown - a glittering glory of bright lights and shiny packages. Charmed by its magic, Jack brings back this newfound holiday to his ghoulish friends, triggering an hilarious turn of events. Told through the innovative technique of stop-motion animation is an unparalleled adventure that dazzles the eye and charms the mind. Cast includes Danny Elfman, Chris Sarandon, Catherine O’Hara, William Hickey, Glenn Shadix.

results.title: The Nightlight
results.creator_credit: Cathrine McVeigh, University of Melbourne and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Set in the early 1950’s this is a moving story of a relationship between a grandfather,’Pop’ who was a soldier in the Lighthorse Brigade during the first World War, and who now is a lighthouse keeper in a very remote and isolated part of Victoria, and his young visiting grandson, Ryan (aged around 12-13 year’s old). Pop appears to be immersed in the memories of the war, the horror and tragedies haunting him continually. He and Ryan engage in war games which become increasingly disturbing for Ryan and his relationship with his grandfather. Filmed in black and white, the lighthouse takes on an almost surreal aspect adding to the haunting mood of this rather tragic tale. Shot on location in Portland and Cape Nelson Lightstation. Cast includes Harold Hopkins, Zach Meyers and Penny Larkins.

results.title: The Night the Prowler
results.creator_credit: Jim Sharman, Anthony Buckley, New South Wales Film Corporation and Chariot Films
results.brief_description: This story begins as a comedy surrounding the reactions of the Bannisters to an alleged attack on their daughter, Felicity. From this point on, Felicity embarks on an odyssey of self-discovery. Adapted by Nobel prize-winning author, Patrick White, from his own short story. Stars John Derum, Maggie Kirkpatrick and Terry Camilleri.

results.title: The Night porter
results.creator_credit: Liliana Cavani, Robert Gordon Edwards, Lotar Films and Ital Noleggio Cinematografico
results.brief_description: It is a dozen years after World War II and a group of ex-Nazis and Gestapo meet regularly in an exclusive hotel in Vienna. The porter at the hotel (Dirk Bogarde) is an ex-SS concentration camp officer who one day recognises one of the hotel’s guests as a former prisoner (Charlotte Rampling) whom he raped when she was fourteen and then proceeded to use as his sex-slave till the end of the war. In meeting again they continue their sado-masochistic relationship which inevitably, and horrifically, leads to tragedy. This controversial film has been praised as profound, denounced as morally corrupt and ridiculed as high camp. It continues to divide audiences.

results.title: The Night of the squid
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Sea Arrow Squids gather in large masses during their annual mating frenzy. The males transfer packets of sperm from their bodies to that of the female by using a specially adapted tentacle. The female attaches the fertilised egg clusters to the sea bottom where they hatch in approximately 28 days. Commentary by Rod Serling.

results.title: The Night of the hunter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: James Agee, Charles Laughton, Paul Gregory and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: On its initial release “The Night of the Hunter” shocked audiences and critics with its combination of lyrical imagery and sadistic violence. However, this masterpiece of horror, directed by actor Charles Laughton and based on a script by author and critic, James Agee, remains one of the most astonishingly beautiful and disturbing films ever made. Two young children are thrown into a nightmarish world when their mother (Shelley Winters), remarries a psychopathic preacher (Robert Mitchum), murder forces them to flee and seek refuge with an old woman (the magnificent Lillian Gish). As the preacher pursues them through the rural splendour of the South, the suspense and terror intensifies to an almost surreal pitch. Also stars James Gleason, Evelyn Varden and Peter Graves. Cinematography is by the master of light, Stanley Cortez. Mitchum’s frightening central performance is possibly the finest work of his career. Based on the novel by Davis Grubb. Music by Walter Schumann.

results.title: The Night of Saint Lawrence = La Notte di San Lorenzo
results.creator_credit: Vittorio Taviani, Paolo Taviani, Giuliani De Negri, Ager Cinematografica and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Cover title: “The Night of the shooting stars.” The villagers of San Martino, Tuscany wish upon shooting stars during the Feast of San Lorenzo. It is August 10, 1944 and there is much to wish for. The Germans are retreating. The Blackshirts, still loyal to The Duce, are sweeping the countryside with kamakaze ferocity. The American GI’s may arrive tomorrow, or never. An extraordinarly touching, involving, richly textured World War II drama of the final days of World War II prior to liberation by U.S. troops. With simple, lyrical but rivetting images, the filmmakers unravel a life-affirming story of war’s absurdities, heroic spirit, hope and survival. Winner Special Prize, Cannes Film Festival. Starring Omero Antonutti and Margarita Lozano. Co-starring Claudio Bigagli, Massimo Bonetti, Norma Martelli, Enrica Maria Modugno and Sabina Vannucchi. Italian dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: The Night is sinister
results.brief_description: An animated film on the history of Western Civilization. Studies the African nations and those colonies which have gained their independence but not their freedom, centreing in particular on Ghana which is still oppressed. Criticizes the way in which foreign aid is being utilized by the Common Market and multinational corporations. Suitable for secondary school level.
